Text: A year ago I went to Wall Street and said we need to re-regulate, and nothing happened.

Text: But the president mentioned the automotive industry and that I was somehow in favor of jobs being elsewhere.

Text: Everywhere in the federal government, there are people who, if they could only touch it with a screwdriver, could fix it.

Text: Anything that would conserve energy or help us use less energy would be fine, and I'm in favor of it.

Text: So, when you try to be holier than thou, it really doesn't work.

Text: If a Black baby is born—and this also applies to Puerto Ricans and Mexicans in some of our cities—it has about half the chance of graduating from high school as a white baby.
source: If a Negro baby is born - and this is true also of Puerto Ricans and Mexicans in some of our cities - he has about one-half as much chance to get through high school as a white baby.

Text: I'm sorry, but indeed there were efforts on the part of the president to negotiate a troop status agreement, and I agreed to that and said that we should keep a certain number of troops on the ground.

Text: We have five treaties with Latin America, including the treaty establishing the Organization of American States in Bogotá in 1948, in which we agreed not to interfere in the internal affairs of another American country - and they also agreed not to do so.
source: We have five treaties with Latin America, including the one setting up the Organization of American States in Bogota in 1948, in which we have agreed not to intervene in the internal affairs of any other American country - and they as well have agreed to do likewise.

Text: This year, we have seen a reduction in the deficit by 21 billion dollars compared to the previous year, mainly due to increased government revenues without raising tax rates.

Text: And by the way, I might say that regarding the 25 percent cut in social security—before I get to answering your question—the only 25 percent cut I know of was related to the great tax increase of 1977, a 25 percent cut in benefits for every American born after 1916.
source: And, incidentally, I might say that with regard to the 25-percent cut in Social Security -- before I get to the answer to your question -- the only 25-percent cut that I know of was accompanying that huge 1977 tax increase, was a cut of 25 percent in the benefits for every American who was born after 1916.

Text: And by the way, I could say that with regard to the 25 percent cut in Social Security—before I come to answering your question—the only 25 percent cut I know of was the one that accompanied the enormous tax increase of 1977 and meant a 25 percent reduction in benefits for every American born after 1916.

Text: But because we had no allies and because it was very unclear that we could actually achieve what we wanted to achieve in terms of deploying military forces there, I think it was right not to jump in, as heartbreaking as it was, but I think we should have intervened in the humanitarian mission much faster.
source: But because we had no allies and because it was very unclear that we could actually accomplish what we would want to accomplish about putting military forces there, I think it was the right thing not to jump in, as heartbreaking as it was, but I think we should have come in much quicker with the humanitarian mission.

Text: But because we had no allies and it was very unclear that we could actually achieve what we wanted to achieve by stationing military forces there, I think it was right not to jump in, as heartbreaking as it was, but I think we should have brought the humanitarian mission much more quickly.
source: But because we had no allies and because it was very unclear that we could actually accomplish what we would want to accomplish about putting military forces there, I think it was the right thing not to jump in, as heartbreaking as it was, but I think we should have come in much quicker with the humanitarian mission.
